section.title: Adding a Ceph Monitor Node
section.para: You should have one or more baremetal servers that meet the minimum hardware requirements for a Ceph monitor node which are documented in the FIXME: broken external xref.

It is recommended to maintain an odd number of Ceph monitors because the Paxos protocol is being used by Ceph monitors to form a consensus. Although clusters can be deployed with a single monitor, we strongly recommend to deploy three monitors on independent nodes for production usage to avoid a single point of failure of the monitor service.
For this reason, it is recommended to increase the number of monitors two at a time if a valid need for more than three exists.

These steps will show you how to add the new Ceph monitor node to your servers.yml file and then run the playbooks that update your cloud configuration. You will run these playbooks from the lifecycle manager.

listitem.para: Log in to your lifecycle manager.
Checkout the site branch of your local git so you can begin to make the necessary edits:

In the same directory, edit your servers.yml file to add the details for your new Ceph monitor nodes. Copy and paste the section for an existing server having the MON-ROLE role and edit the values to match the new server being added.
listitem.screen: - id: ceph-mon4 ip-addr: 10.13.111.141 server-group: RACK1 role: CEP-MON-ROLE nic-mapping: MY-4PORT-SERVER mac-addr: "f0:92:1c:05:69:10" ilo-ip: 10.12.8.217 ilo-password: password ilo-user: admin

important.para: You will need to verify that the ip-addr value you choose for this node does not conflict with any other IP address in your cloud environment. You can confirm this by checking the ~/helion/my_cloud/info/address_info.yml file on your lifecycle manager.

listitem.para: In your control_plane.yml file you will need to check the values for member-count, min-count, and max-count. If you specified them, ensure that they match up with your new total node count. So for example, if you had previously specified member-count: 3 and are adding a fourth Ceph monitor node, you will need to change that value to member-count: 4.

listitem.screen: git commit -a -m "Add new Ceph monitor node <name>"

listitem.para: Add the new node into Cobbler:
Then you can image the node:
listitem.screen: cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost bm-reimage.yml -e nodelist=<node name>

note.para: If you don't know the <node name> already, you can get it by using sudo cobbler system list

listitem.para: Before proceeding, you may want to take a look at ~/helion/my_cloud/info/server_info.yml to see if the assignment of the node you have added is what you expect. It may not be, as nodes will not be numbered consecutively if any have previously been removed. This is to prevent loss of data; the config processor retains data about removed nodes and keeps their ID numbers from being reallocated. See the Persisted Server Allocations section in for information on how this works.
Run the following series of playbooks complete the deployment of your additional Ceph monitor node(s) to your Ceph cluster:
listitem.screen: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --tags "generate_hosts_file" ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml --limit <hostname>
